Angers rejected €10m offer from Villarreal for Baptiste Santamaria

France Football report that La Liga side Villarreal have abandoned their attempts to sign 25-year-old French central midfielder Baptiste Santamaria after his club Angers rejected the €10m proposal that was made to them.

It appears that Francis Coquelin, whose arrival Villarreal announced earlier on Wednesday morning from Valencia, was their second option in this position going into the summer transfer window.

Santamaria had been in talks with the Spanish side since the middle of July and found a provisional contract agreement, but Angers and Villarreal were unable to reach a deal.

Le SCO are seeking €15m in order to part with Santamaria, but Unai Emery and co appear to have moved on.

Cagliari, ongoing contacts for Juan Jesus: the latest

Cagliari are determined to give Eusebio Di Francesco a familiar face for his defense. The Sardinian club are in fact pursuing Juan Jesus, who played a significant role at Roma when Di Francesco managed the club.

The Brazilian defender has one year left on his contract, but earns substantial wages, which leaves Genoa as a possibility who now have sporting director Faggiano who previously pursued Juan Jesus while at Parma, but Cagliari are currently in the lead in the race.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/cagliari-ongoing-contacts-for-juan-jesus-the-latest

Torino, meeting at Casa Milan for Rodriguez: the latest

Torino ar3 working hard to add Ricardo Rodriguez to Marco Giampaolo's squad. Currently the granata's sporting director Davide Vagnati and the Swiss defender's agent Gianluca Di Domenico are at Casa Milan to try to close the deal.

At the moment there's a gap between the demand and the offer, Milan want to avoid taking a loss on Rodriguez' amortized value and aren't willing to sell for less than €3.5 million, while Torino are offering €2 million since the rossoneri would save significantly on the €5 million before taxes wages.

Andrea Pirlo met with the Juventus directors for a six-hour meeting to discuss the season ahead and the preparations being made, including through the transfer market. Milan are determined to improve their defense and are targeting a player Pioli is very familiar with. In fact the rossoneri are in contact with Fiorentina for Nikola Milenkovic, they would like to insert Paqueta' in the deal, but at the moment the Tuscan club haven't opened to the idea and are asking for €40 million, a figure that is considered too high by Milan but could be lowered since Milenkovic has just two years left on his deal.

In addition, Milan have reached an agreement with Ante Rebic, who scored 15 goals last season, on his wages. The rossoneri will now negotiate with Eintracht to acquire the Croatian striker immediately or at the end of next season since they originally acquired Rebic on a two year loan deal by banking on fact they can get better terms since they have an agreement with the player.

CATTERMOLE HANGS UP BOOTS TO CONCENTRATE ON COACHING CAREER

Lee Cattermole has called time on his playing career at the age of 32 as he plots a future in coaching.

The combative former Middlesbrough, Wigan and Sunderland midfielder spent last season in Holland with VVV Venlo until the Eredivisie campaign was cut short by the coronavirus pandemic, and has re-evaluated his future plans during lockdown.

He said: “With the current situation, the amount of time I have had at home and a great season in Holland, the time is right for me to look into going down the coaching route.

“Ordinarily I don’t think it would have been this year, my aim would have been to play two more seasons.

“It was a difficult decision. If the season hadn’t finished like it did in May then things might not have been like this, but I think this is right.”

Juventus, from Milik to Lacazette: the options for the attack

Juventus are focused on bolstering their attack under Andrea Pirlo. The bianconeri's new manager gave the club a list of striker to improve the offense, with some familiar names starting with Arkadiusz Milik, a player that is held in high regard but whose arrival is tied to Bernardeschi's departure. The other options include Edin Dzeko, however Roma don't want to sell him as well as Alvaro Morata and Duvan Zapata who are however very expensive.

Juventus could find the right fit in Alexandre Lacazette who is coming off a season in which he scored ten goals, he's viewed as the best alternative to Milik because of his quality compared to his current price. Lacazette is ahead of Wolverhampton's Jimenez, who is well liked and managed by Jorge Mendes who has a good relationship with the club.

Borussia Dortmund interested in Real Madrid attacker Reinier

According to Ruhr Nachrichten, Borussia Dortmund are very interested in signing 18-year-old Real Madrid attacker Reinier on a one-year loan deal.

Fellow Bundesliga side Bayer Leverkusen have also shown an interest in signing the Brazilian, who joined Real Madrid from Flamengo in January for €30 million.

Although Kicker state that no negotiations have yet taken place, there is talks of an advanced deal in both Brazilian and Spanish reports. It could see Borussia Dortmund sign Reinier on a similar deal to that of Achraf Hakimi, on loan with an option for a further year.

Weston McKennie’s move to Hertha Berlin appears to be off

According to Bild, Schalke midfielder Weston McKennie is not convinced of a transfer to Hertha Berlin and is instead toying with a move to the Premier League.

Although it appears that the transfer is off the table, both Schalke and Hertha Berlin came close to reaching an agreement. Hertha Berlin were ready to pay just short of Schalke’s €25 million valuation.

Premier League club Southampton and Ligue 1 side AS Monaco have both shown interest in signing the 21-year-old American.

Genoa strongly interested in Sampdoria's Caprari

New Genoa Sporting Director Faggiano is on the hunt for a winger, and he's targeting Gianluca Caprari. The 27 year old spent the second half of the season with Parma on loan (he was acquired by Faggiano himself), but is owned by Sampdoria. Historically, Genoa and the blucerchiati have never had direct discussions, but given that Vincenzo Italiano (the first choice for the bench) intends to play a 4-3-3 and the rossoblù do not have any wingers, they will find a way to proceed with the operation.

Parma: Boavista pursuing for Bruno Alves

Bruno Alves will be 39 years old in November, but he's nowhere near to the retirement. Boavista - 12th place in the Portuguese league - in the last hours have asked information for the defender.

The player is evaluating Parma's project, and Parma itself hasn't received any information about a possible farewell from the captain yet. After having arrived from Glasgow Rangers in 2018, Bruno Alves has played an excellent season, with 31 appearances from the first minute in the Italian league.

Barcelona have given Eric Abidal and Ronald Koeman permission to clear out the squad this summer, according to @SiqueRodriguez .

Lyon have made contact for Tiémoué Bakayoko

Téléfoot Chaine report that Ligue 1 side Lyon have made contact with the entourage of French deep-lying midfielder Tiémoué Bakayoko about a possible summer move.

AC Milan are in active conversations via Paolo Maldini about a new loan with option to buy deal with Chelsea, two summers on from completing their last one, but OL have now entered the race, making contact with both the London club and the player’s entourage.

Bakayoko is currently in London and is due back in 1st team training on 23rd August 2020.

Lorient to loan Trevoh Chalobah from Chelsea

As initially reported by Goal, Ligue 1 side FC Lorient have agreed a loan deal with Chelsea for 21-year-old defensive-minded player Trevoh Chalobah.

This will be Chalobah’s third consecutive loan spell away from the London club, after spells at Ipswich and Huddersfield Town.

FCL have not finished their summer business yet as they are still looking to sign a winger.

Juventus, Dzeko at the top of Pirlo’s wishlist: the latest

Juventus are focused on finding the right addition for their frontline. New manager Andrea Pirlo has placed Edin Dzeko at the top of his wish list for the position, the Bosnian is coming off a season in which he scored 19 goals to go with 14 assists, but has yet to give Roma any signals he wants to leave.

The giallorossi consider Dzeko to be a key player on their squad, Fonseca and the new owners want to start the season with him, but should the striker express a desire to leave they would consider the situation based on the offers they receive.

While Juventus have been linked to Arkadiusz Milik who has an expiring contract, should they sign Dzeko, the Polish striker could instead head to Roma to replace him- but so far Milik has yet to open the idea of moving to Italy's capital.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/juventus-dzeko-at-the-top-of-pirlos-wishlist-the-latest

Monza sets Giovinco objective: the latest

Sebastian Giovinco is generating a lot of interest, as well as in Italy. The Atomic Ant, who scored 7 goals and provided 8 assists last season with Al-Hilal, is on Monza's list of objectives. Brocchi's squad, who are active on the transfer market after their return to Serie B, want to tempt the player with an important offer. After playing for teams such as Toronto and Al-Hilal, it could be possible that Berlusconi and Galliani bring him back to Italy.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/en-monza-sets-giovinco-objective-the-latest

Fiorentina enquire about Linetty and waiting on Thiago Silva: the latest

Fiorentina are still working on bringing Thiago Silva back to Italy, but the Brazilian defender is taking his time to make a decision. The PSG player wants to wait until after the Champions League Final is over.

Meanwhile, Fiorentina have also made an enquiry for Sampdoria's Linetty, who is also an objective for Torino. Now that there is some competition, the Granata will have to seek to close the deal as fast as possible. The midfielder scored 4 goals last season for Sampdoria.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/fiorentina-enquire-about-linetty-and-waiting-on-thiago-silva-the-latest

Leeds pursue Valencia striker Rodrigo: the latest

After returning to the Premier League following a sixteen year absence, Leeds are building next season's squad. The club owned by president Radrizzani has an objective for the attack: Rodrigo Moreno Machedo.

The Valencia striker is coming off a season in which he scored 7 goals in 34 matches, but he missed the last few matches with a knee injury. Leeds manager Bielsa is hoping to be able to count on Rodrigo for the first match of season on September 12th against Liverpool.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/leeds-pursue-valencia-striker-rodrigo-the-latest

Fiorentina interested in Chelsea's Zappacosta: the latest

Fiorentina are looking for a right-back and during the day there was contact for Davide Zappacosta, who has returned to Chelsea. He only had 9 appearances with Roma because of a ruptured anterior cruciate legament, which kept him out for the majority of the season. The Viola met with his agent, Lucci, and the move could be completed on a loan basis. Another name for Fiorentina is Florenzi, but he is closer to Everton at the moment. Finally, the Viola are interested in Pescara's Gabriele Zappa, who made 26 appearances and scored 5 goals to help the Delfini to stay in Serie B. Benevento are also interested in the player.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/en-fiorentina-interested-in-chelseas-zappacosta-the-latest

Lionel Messi tells Ronald Koeman he’s unclear on his future at Barcelona – RAC1

RAC1 report that Lionel Messi has told new Barcelona coach Ronald Koeman his future at the club remains unclear.

The Catalan outlet says that Messi is leaning more towards leaving the club than staying, however, the club captain is also aware that leaving would be very difficult due to conditions in his contract. The Argentine’s current contract runs to 2021.

Barcelona maintain he is still under contract but are aware of his possible desire to leave.

Tim Krul has been identified as a candidate to provide support for Barcelona goalkeeper Victor Valdes, according to reports.
Newcastle United kept the Dutch goalkeeper this summer despite speculation linking a number of clubs with a bid for the 24-year-old.

However, Alan Pardew could face another fight to hold on Krul with Barcelona preparing a bid to lure him to the Camp Nou next summer, suggests The Mirror.

Barcelona's current second choice goalkeeper is Jose Pinto but Tito Vilanova is rumoured to be keen to find a replacement for the 36-year-old.

Krul may choose to remain with Newcastle though, with Valdes having been a regular for the Spanish giants for a number of years.

Thiago Silva giving his priority to Chelsea offer

Téléfoot Chaine, on their first official night in business, report that 35-year-old Brazilian central defender Thiago Silva is giving his priority to Premier League side Chelsea as the club he wants to join after PSG’s Champions’ League adventure comes to an end this weekend.

His contract expires at the end of August, and of the offers that he has received to join new clubs on a free transfer, Silva is prioritising the proposal from Chelsea.

Fiorentina has made an offer, but contrary to Italian reporting, there is no agreement between these two parties.

Sources tell Get French Football News that the player would still prefer to remain at PSG, and if they make a last minute contract extension offer, then he would likely take it.

Fenerbahce in negotiations with Bordeaux for Samuel Kalu

Manu Lonjon reports that Turkish side Fenerbahce are talks with Ligue 1 side Bordeaux over the loan with option to buy signing of Nigerian international winger Samuel Kalu.

The two clubs are currently negotiating terms. Contrary to Turkish reporting, there are no active discussions between the Nigerian and other major Turkish outfit Galatasaray.

Atalanta closing in on signing of Liège defender Vojvoda, with PSG and Leicester interested in Castagne

The Bergamo edition of Corriere della Sera reports today that Atalanta are closing in on the signing of Kosovar defender Mërgim Vojvoda from Standard Liège.

The deal could move ahead with the imminent departure of Timothy Castagne, who has attracted interest from Paris Saint-Germain, Hertha Berlin and Leicester. The latter are also interested in German full-back Robin Gosens, who would be a potential replacement for the outgoing Ben Chilwell.

Rennes in advanced talks to land Islam Slimani for €8m

As reported by our colleagues at Téléfoot Chaine and Foot Mercato, Rennes are in advanced negotiations to sign 32-year-old Algerian international Islam Slimani from Premier League side Leicester City for a reported €8m.

Chelsea in talks to sign Malang Sarr

Sky Sports report that Premier League side Chelsea are engaged in talks to sign free agent French central defender Malang Sarr.

The 21-year-old held conversations with ex-Barcelona Director of Football Éric Abidal recently, and also has a firm offer from Serie A side Torino.

The outlet in question understands that were Frank Lampard’s side to sign Sarr, then they would loan him immediately back out for the 2020/21 season.

Lille have received offers from Inter Milan & Leicester for Jonathan Ikoné

Téléfoot Chaine report that Ligue 1 side Lille have received offers from Premier League side Leicester City and Italian outfit Inter Milan for French international attacking midfielder Jonathan Ikoné.

The outlet announced the news during commentary of tonight’s match between Lille and Rennes. They claim that the club is not convinced about selling the ex-PSG youth prospect at the moment and suggest that the player himself has not indicated a clear desire to leave at this stage of the transfer window.

According to Kicker, 22-year-old Stuttgart striker Nicolás González wants to depart the club during the upcoming summer transfer window.

The Argentinian forward was a main reason as to why Stuttgart were promoted as runners-up from 2. Bundesliga last season, scoring 14 goals in 27 league appearances.

González’s intentions to leave will come as little surprise to Stuttgart fans though as attacker has been the subject of intense interest from a range of European clubs in recent weeks. Premier League newcomers Leeds United are in particular very interested in acquiring the services of the Argentinian international.

Stuttgart sports director Sven Mislintat told Kicker: “Nobody wants to make predictions, especially not in times of Corona. Let’s be honest: If someone comes on October 1st and puts a fabulous sum of 30 million euros plus on the table for Nico or another player – who should refuse something like that?”

Mislintat was quick to emphasise though: “I don’t see it coming either.”

Inter, meeting between Conte & Zhang on Tuesday: the latest

The day of truth is upon us, on August 25th Inter will have some clarity about their future once President Zhang meets with Antonio Conte. The two will find out if they can rally around a common vision for the club and move on together, especially in light of the fact that Inter cannot promise further significant investments on the market after already splurging on Hakimi- the club will look for opportunities while paying close attention to the balance sheet.

Should Conte insist on raising the bar it maybe difficult for the parties to reach an agreement and it will be up to the manager to make a decision. Should there be a separation, the formula of the divorce remains to be seen- a sacking or a mutual partying of ways with Conte giving up an annual salary of €12 million net of taxes for next two years.

Should this scenario unfold, Massimiliano Allegri is waiting in the wings after giving the priority to the nerazzurri over Paris St Germain. The situation is evolving but there will be clarity after the meeting between Conte and Zhang.

Yvon Mvogo (RB Leipzig) close to joining PSV on 2-year loan

Mvogo has played just 19 competitive games for RB Leipzig, finding himself behind the impressive Péter Gulácsi. The Swiss stopper wants first team football to keep him place in the international setup.

Crystal Palace looking at potential move for Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz 05)

Bild report that Crystal Palace are interested in signing 23-year-old Mainz striker Jean-Philippe Mateta this summer.

The Frenchman has enjoyed a solid two-year spell with Bundesliga outfit Mainz to date having joined from Ligue 1 side Lyon in the summer of 2018 for €8 million.

Despite struggling this season with injuries that limited his game time, the 6′4″ attacker has scored a total of 17 goals in 52 league appearances over the past two seasons for Mainz.

With Crystal Palace seemingly desperate for a new number nine, talks between the two clubs are already underway with Bild reporting that Palace sporting director Dougie Freedman has already visited Mainz officials in Germany.

The Premier League club will need to pay a fee around €15 million before Mainz consider selling the 23-year-old.

L'Équipe report that there are forces inside PSG who want to offer Thiago Silva a last-gasp contract extension, which could scupper a move to Chelsea. It is no secret that Thomas Tuchel wants him to stay, but Sporting Director Leonardo wants him to go.

Trabzonspor trying loan with option to buy deal with St Étienne for Wahbi Khazri – player unsure

Turkish side Trabzonspor have spent the last few days negotiating with Ligue 1 club St Étienne over the possible loan with option to buy deal for 29-year-old Tunisian international attacking midfielder Wahbi Khazri, according to Manu Lonjon and Foot Mercato.

A deal is by no means certain, the Turks are cash poor and do not seem able to match Khazri’s current salary. A loan with option to buy deal would see the option worth less than the €6m to €8m discussed by other media.

Khazri is very unsure about a deal & is currently reflecting on it.

Leeds United in negotiations with Valencia for striker Rodrigo Moreno

Leeds United are in negotiations with Valencia for striker Rodrigo Moreno, according to Valencia-based journalist Héctor Gómez.

Jorge Mendes is the agent involved in the deal linking the 29-year-old with a move to Elland Road. Leeds owner Andrea Radrizzani and sporting director Victor Orta are in Valencia to discuss a deal for the Spain international with club president Anil Murthy.

Reports suggest that the fee being discussed is in the region €35m plus add-ons. Valencia are keen to complete the deal in order to generate some much-needed revenue to rebuild a shrinking squad. Moreno didn’t play in Saturday’s friendly against Castellón as talks continued with the Premier League club
